  • workflows.dirt2d.process

Source code for workflows.dirt2d.process

'''
    The code to run the workflow code on a sample
'''
import subprocess
import os
from os.path import join
import csv


[docs]def process_sample(name,path,args):
    '''
        Process a sample within the collection.

        Args:
            name (str): name of the sample
            path (str): path to the sample file(s)
            args (dict): workflow parameters
    '''

    #Create traits file
    with open("traits.csv",'w') as fout:
        traits = args['traits']
        for (_,group) in traits['groups'].items():
            for (param,value) in group['params'].items():
                fout.write(param + "," + str(int(value)) + "\n")

    settings = args['settings']['params']
    cmd = ['python','/opt/DIRT/main.py',
                    path,                          # full path to file with the root image
                    1,                             # ID which will be a folder name in the working directory. Integer value needed
                    settings['mask'],              # multiplier for the automatically determined mask threshold
                    int(settings['excised']),      #1 - excised root analysis is on, 0 - excised root analysis is off
                    int(settings['crown']) ,       # 1 - crown root analysis is on, 0 - crown root analysis is off
                    int(settings['segmentation']), #1 -  is on, 0 - is off
                    settings['marker_diameter'],   # a simple decimal e.g. 25.4. If 0.0 is used, then the output will have pixels as unit.
                    int(settings['reconstruct']),  # <stem reconstruction> 1 - reconstruction is turned on, 0 - reconstruction is turned off
                    0,                             #<plots> 1 - plotting data is stored, 0 - plotting data is not stored
                    0,                             #<output format> 1 - the full trait set is put into one excel file containing empty cells for traits that were not computed, 0 - only computed files are written to the output file
                    os.getcwd(),                   #full path to folder were the result is stored
                    join(os.getcwd(),'traits.csv') #full path to .csv file containing the traits to be computed
            ]
    subprocess.run([str(s) for s in cmd])

    with open('1/output.csv','r') as fin:
        csv_reader = csv.DictReader(fin)
        data = csv_reader.__next__()

    return {'key-val': data}
